name: Reference - CAR-2021-01-006: Unusual Child Process spawned using DDE exploit - MITRE
x_kb_abstract: Adversaries may use Windows Dynamic Data Exchange (DDE) to execute arbitrary commands. DDE is a client-server protocol for one-time and/or continuous inter-process communication (IPC) between applications. Once a link is established, applications can autonomously exchange transactions consisting of strings, warm data links (notifications when a data item changes), hot data links (duplications of changes to a data item), and requests for command execution.
x_kb_reference_title: CAR-2021-01-006: Unusual Child Process spawned using DDE exploit
